posts.post_content: I've decided to build my T206 set alphabetically, one letter at a time, and have just made my way through the As (thanks for the Ames - Hands at Chest, Larry...you're the best).  I'm now starting my way through the Bs.  I'm open to any you may have graded PSA 3 to PSA 5 and am particularly interested in a Bastian with an Old Mill back.  Please let me know if you have any that fit the bill!
Just be thankful you're not doing T207.   The "B's" really are killer ... ;)
Just PSA?  I have a Bastian Old Mill that is SGC40 that I might be willing to part with.

Neat idea.  "I" "U" "Q" and "Z" will be relatively easy.  "V" is for "Violat" the only V in the set.  No "X" factors to worry about.  

Also, keep in mind that T206 is "top heavy" when it comes to the first half of the alphabet, with 350+ subjects starting with A-M.

I'd be curious to hear how this turns out for you....

This is the way I've been collecting as well, and I'm also in the "B's":

[url]http://www.psacard.com/PSASETREGISTRY/publishedset.aspx?s=50230&ac=1[/url]

Good luck to you!
